snippet: After helping topple communism in Eastern Europe in 1989, Prime Minister Victor Orban of Hungary has come to question Western values.
abstract: Hungarian Prime Min Viktor Orban openly advocates authoritarian 'illiberal democracy' and, unlike many Eastern European countries, is strengthening ties with Russia; Western leaders and internal opponents draw comparisons with Russian Pres Vladimir Putin as Orban rapidly centralizes power and cracks down on dissent.

byline.original: By RICK LYMAN and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Palko Karasz and Andras Nagy contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: After helping topple communism in Eastern Europe in 1989, Prime Minister Victor Orban of Hungary has come to question Western values.

headline.seo: Viktor Orban Steers Hungary Toward Russia 25 Years After Fall of the Berlin Wall
headline.main: Defying Soviets, Then Pulling Hungary to Putin
headline.print_headline: Defying Soviets, Then Pulling Hungary to Putin
